info.title: SAP Advanced Financial Closing Scheduling Service Provider Interface
info.description: The Scheduling Service Provider Interface of SAP Advanced Financial Closing allows the integration of third-party scheduling systems with SAP Advanced Financial Closing. It includes the retrieval of job definitions, as well as the scheduling and synchronization of jobs. See OpenAPI Specification on SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

x-sap-shortText: Defines how an application can integrate with job scheduling provider service

get.description: The operation allows you to retrieve capabilities.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of query results to skip. A value less than 0 SHALL be interpreted as 0. Example: ?skip=10

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Non-negative integer. Specifies the desired maximum number of query results to return per page. Example: ?top=10

parameters.name: referenceID
parameters.description: Allows filtering of query results by referenceID. Example: ?referenceID=01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Allows filtering of query results by name. Example: ?name=JOB_1 (optional)

get.description: The operation allows you to retrieve a list of job based on the provided parameters.

post.description: The operation allows you to create a single job.

parameters.description: key: ID
parameters.name: ID

get.summary: Retrieves a list of results of a job.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of query results to skip. A value less than 0 SHALL be interpreted as 0. Example: ?skip=10

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Non-negative integer. Specifies the desired maximum number of query results to return per page. Example: ?top=10

get.summary: Retrieves a list of job definition.

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: The number of query results to skip. A value less than 0 SHALL be interpreted as 0. Example: ?skip=10

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Non-negative integer. Specifies the desired maximum number of query results to return per page. Example: ?top=10

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Allows case-sensitive filtering of query results by search on name. Wildcard support at start and end via *. Example: ?name=JOB* (optional)

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: Allows case-insensitive filtering of query results by search on name, description and long description. Example: ?search=Job (optional)

status.description: Final statuses are 'completed', 'completedWithWarning', 'completedWithError', 'failed', and 'canceled', no further status transitions are then allowed

400.description: Incorrect request. Format or structure invalid

403.description: Access forbidden. The caller does not have the required permissions to access the resource

404.description: Resource not found. The caller either provided a wrong URL or the requested resource does not exist (any longer).

406.description: Not acceptable. The caller provided content negotiation headers such as Accept, Accept-Charset, Accept-Encoding, and Accept- Language, for which the server could not produce a matching result.

409.description: Request conflict. State of the resource does not permit the request.

413.description: Payload Too Large. The request entity is larger than limits defined by the server.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type. The server refuses to accept the request because the payload has an unsupported format.

429.description: Too many requests. The caller has sent too many requests in a given amount of time

500.description: Internal server error. The requested operation led to an error during execution

501.description: Not implemented. The server does not support the functionality required to fulfill the request

503.description: Service unavailable. The server is not able to handle the request at present. If no Retry-After is given, the client SHOULD handle the response as it would for a 500 response.

Retry-After.description: Indicates how long the client should wait before making a follow-up request, specified as a number of seconds

oauth2.description: To access this API, use the OAuth 2.0 client credentials grant flow.

bearer.description: To access this API, use the HTTP bearer authentication.
